intro: Zizzia tortuosa, commonly known as the twisted zizzia, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Zizzia tortuosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its unique, winding stems contribute to its common name and make it a distinctive sight in its natural habitat.
